Package ex.dev.sdk.rf88

Class Rf88Manager

java.lang.Object
ex.dev.sdk.rf88.Rf88Manager
public class Rf88Manager extends Object
RF88 RFID handheld device management class.

This is the main entry point for controlling the RF88 RFID device. It provides a unified API for RFID operations, device configuration, and system management. The class follows a singleton pattern to ensure consistent device state management across the application.

The manager handles two main functional areas:

  • RFID Operations: Tag inventory, read, write, kill, and lock operations
  • System Management: Device configuration, battery monitoring, and hardware control

All methods are designed to be thread-safe and include automatic error handling through the internal Throwable.execute wrapper.

Since:
3.0.0

    • setDebugMode

      public static void setDebugMode(boolean isEnabled)
      Enables or disables debug mode for the SDK.

      When debug mode is enabled, detailed logging information will be output to help with troubleshooting and development.

      Parameters:
      isEnabled - true to enable debug mode, false to disable

    • connect

      public void connect(String address)
      Attempts to connect to the RF88 device via Bluetooth communication.

      This method establishes a wired connection to the RF88 device. The connection state changes will be reported through the OnConnectionStateChangedListener if one has been registered.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.BLUETOOTH_CONNECT

      See Also:
      • setOnConnectionStateChangedListener(OnConnectionStateChangedListener)

    • connect

      public void connect()
      Attempts to connect to the RF88 device via UART communication.

      This method establishes a wired connection to the RF88 device. The connection state changes will be reported through the OnConnectionStateChangedListener if one has been registered.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.UART_CONNECT

      See Also:
      • setOnConnectionStateChangedListener(OnConnectionStateChangedListener)

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Disconnects from the currently connected RF88 device.

      This method safely terminates the connection to the RF88 device and cleans up associated resources. The disconnection event will be reported through the OnConnectionStateChangedListener if one has been registered.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.DISCONNECT

      See Also:
      • setOnConnectionStateChangedListener(OnConnectionStateChangedListener)

    • setOnInventoryResultListener

      public void setOnInventoryResultListener(@Nullable ex.dev.sdk.rf88.frameworks.listener.OnInventoryResultListener listener)
      Sets a listener to receive RFID inventory operation results.

      This listener will be called whenever RFID tags are discovered during inventory operations. The listener receives tag data including EPC, RSSI, and other configured packet options.

      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to receive inventory results, or null to remove

    • setOnHardwareKeyListener

      public void setOnHardwareKeyListener(@Nullable ex.dev.sdk.rf88.frameworks.listener.OnHardwareKeyListener listener)
      Sets a listener to receive hardware key events from the RF88 device.

      This listener will be called when hardware buttons on the RF88 device are pressed or released. The key mapping can be configured using setDualTriggerFunctionCode(String).

      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to receive hardware key events, or null to remove
      See Also:
      • setDualTriggerFunctionCode(String)

      public void setOnConnectionStateChangedListener(@Nullable ex.dev.sdk.rf88.frameworks.listener.OnConnectionStateChangedListener listener)
      Sets a listener to receive connection state change events.

      This listener will be called when the connection state between the host and the RF88 device changes (connected, disconnected, etc.).

      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to receive connection state changes, or null to remove

      public void setOnActionExecutingListener(@Nullable ex.dev.sdk.rf88.frameworks.listener.OnActionExecutingListener listener)
      Sets a listener to receive notifications when actions are being executed.

      This listener provides feedback on the current operation status, useful for showing progress indicators or operation status to users.

      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to receive action execution events, or null to remove

    • inventory

      public void inventory()
      Executes an RFID inventory operation to discover all visible tags.

      This method starts a continuous inventory operation that will discover all RFID tags within the RF88's read range. Results are delivered through the OnInventoryResultListener.

      The inventory operation will continue until stop() is called.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_INVENTORY

      See Also:
      • setOnInventoryResultListener(OnInventoryResultListener)
      • stop()

    • inventory

      public void inventory(String mask)
      Executes an RFID inventory operation with tag filtering.

      This method starts a filtered inventory operation that will only discover RFID tags matching the specified mask. The mask filtering uses the current memory bank and pointer configuration set by setMemoryBank(String) and setPointer(String).

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_INVENTORY

      Parameters:
      mask - The tag data to use as a filter mask. Tags matching this mask will be returned
      See Also:
      • setMemoryBank(String)
      • setPointer(String)

    • inventoryAndRead

      public void inventoryAndRead(String memoryBank, String pointer, String length)
      Executes an RFID inventory operation and simultaneously reads data from the specified memory area.

      This method starts a continuous inventory operation that discovers all RFID tags within the RF88s read range, and for each discovered tag, it immediately reads the memory content defined by memoryBank, pointer, and length. Both the inventory and read results are returned together.

      The operation will continue until stop() is called.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_INVENTORY_AND_READ

      Parameters:
      memoryBank - The memory bank to read from (e.g. "EPC", "TID", "USER", "RESERVED")
      pointer - The start address (bit offset) for reading
      length - The number of words (1 word = 16 bits) to read
      See Also:
      • stop()
      • setMemoryBank(String)
      • setPointer(String)

    • inventoryAndRead

      public void inventoryAndRead(String memoryBank, String pointer, String length, String mask)
      Executes an RFID inventory and read operation with tag filtering.

      This method starts a filtered inventory operation that targets only tags matching the specified mask, and for each matching tag, reads data from the specified memoryBank, pointer, and length. The mask filtering uses the current memory bank and pointer configuration set by setMemoryBank(String) and setPointer(String).

      The operation will continue until stop() is called.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_INVENTORY_AND_READ

      Parameters:
      memoryBank - The memory bank to read from (e.g. "EPC", "TID", "USER", "RESERVED")
      pointer - The start address (bit offset) for reading
      length - The number of words (1 word = 16 bits) to read
      mask - The mask data used for tag filtering. Only tags matching this mask will be returned.
      See Also:
      • stop()
      • setMemoryBank(String)
      • setPointer(String)

    • read

      @NonNull public String read(String memoryBank, String pointer, String length)
      Reads data from an RFID tag's memory bank.

      This method performs a synchronous read operation on RFID tags. If multiple tags are present, the operation will read from the first responding tag.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_READ

      Parameters:
      memoryBank - The memory bank to read from:
      • Configuration.MemoryBank.RESERVED - Reserved memory (passwords, etc.)
      • Configuration.MemoryBank.EPC - EPC memory
      • Configuration.MemoryBank.TID - Tag Identifier memory
      • Configuration.MemoryBank.USER - User memory
      pointer - The word offset within the memory bank where reading should start
      length - The number of words to read
      Returns:
      The hex string data read from the tag, or empty string if operation failed

    • read

      @NonNull public String read(String memoryBank, String pointer, String length, String mask)
      Reads data from a specific RFID tag's memory bank using tag filtering.

      This method performs a synchronous read operation on a specific RFID tag identified by the mask parameter. The mask filtering uses the current memory bank and pointer configuration.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_READ

      Parameters:
      memoryBank - The memory bank to read from
      pointer - The word offset within the memory bank where reading should start
      length - The number of words to read
      mask - The tag data to use as a filter to select the target tag
      Returns:
      The hex string data read from the tag, or empty string if operation failed

    • write

      @NonNull public String write(String memoryBank, String pointer, String newValue)
      Writes data to an RFID tag's memory bank.

      This method performs a synchronous write operation on RFID tags. If multiple tags are present, the operation will write to the first responding tag.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_WRITE

      Parameters:
      memoryBank - The memory bank to write to:
      • Configuration.MemoryBank.RESERVED - Reserved memory (passwords, etc.)
      • Configuration.MemoryBank.EPC - EPC memory
      • Configuration.MemoryBank.TID - Tag Identifier memory
      • Configuration.MemoryBank.USER - User memory
      pointer - The word offset within the memory bank where writing should start
      newValue - The hex string data to write to the tag
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • write

      @NonNull public String write(String memoryBank, String pointer, String newValue, String mask)
      Writes data to a specific RFID tag's memory bank using tag filtering.

      This method performs a synchronous write operation on a specific RFID tag identified by the mask parameter.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_WRITE

      Parameters:
      memoryBank - The memory bank to write to
      pointer - The word offset within the memory bank where writing should start
      newValue - The hex string data to write to the tag
      mask - The tag data to use as a filter to select the target tag
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • writeAccessPassword

      @NonNull public String writeAccessPassword(String newValue)
      Writes the access password to the reserved memory area of an RFID tag.

      The access password is written to word offset 2 in the reserved memory bank. This password is required for future read/write operations if the tag is locked.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_WRITE

      Parameters:
      newValue - A hex string of up to 8 characters (32 bits) representing the access password
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • writeAccessPassword

      @NonNull public String writeAccessPassword(String newValue, String mask)
      Writes the access password to the reserved memory area of a specific RFID tag.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_WRITE

      Parameters:
      newValue - A hex string of up to 8 characters (32 bits) representing the access password
      mask - The tag data to use as a filter to select the target tag
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • writeKillPassword

      @NonNull public String writeKillPassword(String newValue)
      Writes the kill password to the reserved memory area of an RFID tag.

      The kill password is written to word offset 0 in the reserved memory bank. This password is required for the kill(String) operation.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_WRITE

      Parameters:
      newValue - A hex string of up to 8 characters (32 bits) representing the kill password
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed
      See Also:
      • kill(String)

    • writeKillPassword

      @NonNull public String writeKillPassword(String newValue, String mask)
      Writes the kill password to the reserved memory area of a specific RFID tag.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_WRITE

      Parameters:
      newValue - A hex string of up to 8 characters (32 bits) representing the kill password
      mask - The tag data to use as a filter to select the target tag
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • kill

      @NonNull public String kill(String password)
      Permanently disables an RFID tag using the kill password.

      This operation permanently disables the target RFID tag, making it unresponsive to all future RFID operations. This action cannot be undone.

      Warning: This operation permanently destroys the tag's functionality. Use with extreme caution.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_KILL

      Parameters:
      password - The kill password previously set on the RFID tag
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed
      See Also:
      • writeKillPassword(String)

    • kill

      @NonNull public String kill(String password, String mask)
      Permanently disables a specific RFID tag using the kill password and tag filtering.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_KILL

      Parameters:
      password - The kill password previously set on the RFID tag
      mask - The tag data to use as a filter to select the target tag
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • lock

      @NonNull public String lock(ex.dev.sdk.rf88.domain.enums.LockMemoryMask memoryMask, ex.dev.sdk.rf88.domain.enums.LockActionMask actionMask)
      Locks specific memory regions of an RFID tag.

      This operation controls access permissions for different memory banks of an RFID tag according to the EPC Gen2 specification.

      Please refer to Table 6.50: "Lock Action-field functionality" in the EPC Gen2 spec for detailed information about memory and action mask values.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_LOCK

      Parameters:
      memoryMask - The memory mask specifying which memory regions to lock. For example, if the target bank is TID, then memoryMask = "00030"
      actionMask - The action mask specifying the lock actions for the memory regions. For example, if actionMask = "00020", access password will be required for future read/write operations
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • lock

      @NonNull public String lock(ex.dev.sdk.rf88.domain.enums.LockMemoryMask memoryMask, ex.dev.sdk.rf88.domain.enums.LockActionMask actionMask, String mask)
      Locks specific memory regions of a specific RFID tag.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_LOCK

      Parameters:
      memoryMask - The memory mask specifying which memory regions to lock
      actionMask - The action mask specifying the lock actions for the memory regions
      mask - The tag data to use as a filter to select the target tag
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the currently running RFID operation.

      This method stops any ongoing RFID operation such as inventory, read, write, kill, or lock operations.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.OPERATION_STOP

    • getRfidVersion

      @NonNull public String getRfidVersion()
      Gets the firmware version of the RFID module.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_RFID_VERSION

      Returns:
      The RFID module firmware version string, or empty string if unavailable

    • getPower

      @NonNull public String getPower()
      Gets the current transmit power value applied to the RFID module.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_POWER

      Returns:
      The current power value (0-300), or empty string if unavailable

    • setPower

      @NonNull public String setPower(String newValue)
      Sets the transmit power value for the RFID module.

      Higher power values increase the read range but also increase power consumption

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_POWER

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new power value (0-300)
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getLinkProfile

      @NonNull public String getLinkProfile()
      Gets the current link profile value applied to the RFID module.

      Link profiles define the communication parameters between the reader and tags, including data rate, modulation, and encoding settings.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_LINK_PROFILE

      Returns:
      The current link profile value, or empty string if unavailable. Common values include:
      • 103: read rate DSB 6.25, 1.5, 640, M1
      • 302: read rate PR 7.5, 2, 640, M1
      • 120: read rate DSB 6.25, 1.5, 640, M2
      • 323: read rate PR 7.5, 2, 640, M2
      • 345: read rate PR 7.5, 1.5, 640, M4
      • 344: ET-UB(D) PR 15, 2, 640, M4
      • 223: ET-LB PR 15, 2, 320, M4
      • 222: ET-LB PR 20, 2, 320, M2
      • 241: ET-LB(D) PR 20, 2, 320, M4
      • 244: FCC(D) PR 20, 2, 250, M4
      • 285: Sens PR 20, 2, 160, M8

    • setLinkProfile

      @NonNull public String setLinkProfile(String newValue)
      Sets the link profile value for the RFID module.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_LINK_PROFILE

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new link profile value
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed
      See Also:
      • getLinkProfile()

    • getStartQ

      @NonNull public String getStartQ()
      Gets the current Start Q value applied to the RFID module.

      The Start Q parameter determines the initial Q value for the EPC Gen2 singulation algorithm, affecting inventory performance with multiple tags.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_START_Q

      Returns:
      The current Start Q value (0-15), or empty string if unavailable

    • setStartQ

      @NonNull public String setStartQ(String newValue)
      Sets the Start Q value for the RFID module.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_START_Q

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new Start Q value (0-15)
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getMinQ

      @NonNull public String getMinQ()
      Gets the current Min Q value applied to the RFID module.

      The Min Q parameter sets the lower bound for the dynamic Q algorithm in EPC Gen2 singulation.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_MIN_Q

      Returns:
      The current Min Q value (0-15), or empty string if unavailable

    • setMinQ

      @NonNull public String setMinQ(String newValue)
      Sets the Min Q value for the RFID module.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_MIN_Q

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new Min Q value (0-15)
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getMaxQ

      @NonNull public String getMaxQ()
      Gets the current Max Q value applied to the RFID module.

      The Max Q parameter sets the upper bound for the dynamic Q algorithm in EPC Gen2 singulation.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_MAX_Q

      Returns:
      The current Max Q value (0-15), or empty string if unavailable

    • setMaxQ

      @NonNull public String setMaxQ(String newValue)
      Sets the Max Q value for the RFID module.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_MAX_Q

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new Max Q value (0-15)
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getIncrementQ

      @NonNull public String getIncrementQ()
      Gets the activation status of the Increment Q algorithm in the RFID module.

      When enabled, the Q value will be automatically incremented when tag collisions are detected during inventory operations.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_INCREMENT_Q

      Returns:
      The Increment Q status: "1" if enabled, "0" if disabled, or empty string if unavailable

    • setIncrementQ

      @NonNull public String setIncrementQ(String newValue)
      Sets whether the RFID module will activate the Increment Q algorithm.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_INCREMENT_Q

      Parameters:
      newValue - "1" to enable, "0" to disable
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getDecrementQ

      @NonNull public String getDecrementQ()
      Gets the activation status of the Decrement Q algorithm in the RFID module.

      When enabled, the Q value will be automatically decremented when no tag responses are detected during inventory operations.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_DECREMENT_Q

      Returns:
      The Decrement Q status: "1" if enabled, "0" if disabled, or empty string if unavailable

    • setDecrementQ

      @NonNull public String setDecrementQ(String newValue)
      Sets whether the RFID module will activate the Decrement Q algorithm.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_DECREMENT_Q

      Parameters:
      newValue - "1" to enable, "0" to disable
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getFixedQ

      @NonNull public String getFixedQ()
      Gets the activation status of the Fixed Q algorithm in the RFID module.

      When enabled, the Q value remains constant during inventory operations rather than being dynamically adjusted.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_FIXED_Q

      Returns:
      The Fixed Q status: "1" if enabled, "0" if disabled, or empty string if unavailable

    • setFixedQ

      @NonNull public String setFixedQ(String newValue)
      Sets whether the RFID module will activate the Fixed Q algorithm.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_FIXED_Q

      Parameters:
      newValue - "1" to enable, "0" to disable
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getSearchMode

      @NonNull public String getSearchMode()
      Gets the current search mode that the RFID module is operating in.

      The search mode determines how the reader handles tag inventory sessions according to the EPC Gen2 specification.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_SEARCH_MODE

      Returns:
      The search mode value:
      • "0" - Dual Target mode
      • "1" - Single Target A mode
      • "2" - Single Target B mode
      Returns empty string if unavailable

    • setSearchMode

      @NonNull public String setSearchMode(String newValue)
      Sets the search mode for the RFID module.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_SEARCH_MODE

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new search mode value: "0" for Dual Target, "1" for Single Target A, "2" for Single Target B
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getSession

      @NonNull public String getSession()
      Gets the current session value applied to the RFID module.

      Sessions determine tag persistence and inventory behavior according to the EPC Gen2 specification.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_SESSION

      Returns:
      The session value: "0", "1", "2", or "3", or empty string if unavailable

    • setSession

      @NonNull public String setSession(String newValue)
      Sets the session value for the RFID module.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_SESSION

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new session value ("0", "1", "2", or "3")
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getTarget

      @NonNull public String getTarget()
      Gets the current target value applied to the RFID module.

      Please refer to Table 6.29: "Select" in the EPC Gen2 specification for detailed information about target values.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_TARGET

      Returns:
      The target value:
      • "0" - S0 inventoried (000)
      • "1" - S1 inventoried (001)
      • "2" - S2 inventoried (010)
      • "3" - S3 inventoried (011)
      • "4" - SL (100)
      Returns empty string if unavailable

    • setTarget

      @NonNull public String setTarget(String newValue)
      Sets the target value for the RFID module.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_TARGET

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new target value ("0" through "4")
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getAction

      @NonNull public String getAction()
      Gets the current action value applied to the RFID module.

      Please refer to Table 6.29: "Select" in the EPC Gen2 specification for detailed information about action values.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_ACTION

      Returns:
      The action value ("0" through "5"), or empty string if unavailable

    • setAction

      @NonNull public String setAction(String newValue)
      Sets the action value for the RFID module.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_ACTION

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new action value ("0" through "5")
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getMemoryBank

      @NonNull public String getMemoryBank()
      Gets the current memory bank setting applied to the RFID module.

      This setting is used for select operations to specify which memory bank should be used for tag filtering.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_MEMORY_BANK

      Returns:
      The memory bank value:
      • "0" - Reserved memory
      • "1" - EPC memory
      • "2" - TID memory
      • "3" - User memory
      Returns empty string if unavailable

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_MEMORY_BANK

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new memory bank value ("0" through "3")
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getPointer

      @NonNull public String getPointer()
      Gets the current pointer value applied to the RFID module.

      The pointer specifies the starting word offset within the memory bank for select operations. Please refer to Table 6.29: "Select" in the EPC Gen2 specification for detailed information.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_POINTER

      Returns:
      The pointer value, or empty string if unavailable

    • setPointer

      @NonNull public String setPointer(String newValue)

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_POINTER

      newValue - The new pointer value (word offset)
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getAccessPassword

      @NonNull public String getAccessPassword()
      Gets the current access password applied to the RFID module.

      This password is used for accessing password-protected RFID operations.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_ACCESS_PASSWORD

      Returns:
      The current access password (hex string), or empty string if unavailable

    • setAccessPassword

      @NonNull public String setAccessPassword(String newValue)
      Sets the access password for the RFID module.

      This password will be used for future RFID operations that require password authentication.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_ACCESS_PASSWORD

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new access password (hex string up to 8 characters)
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getPacketOption

      @NonNull public String getPacketOption()
      Gets the current packet option applied to the RFID module.

      Packet options determine which additional data is included with inventory results. Options can be combined additively.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_PACKET_OPTION

      Returns:
      The current packet option value:
      • "1" - Include checksum
      • "2" - Include RSSI
      • "8" - Include frequency
      • "32" - EPC only (cannot be combined with others)
      Returns empty string if unavailable

    • setPacketOption

      @NonNull public String setPacketOption(String newValue)
      Sets the packet option for the RFID module.

      The option value can be mixed additively (e.g., 11 = 1 + 2 + 8 for checksum + RSSI + frequency). Note that option 32 cannot be combined with others.

      Data is added to tag results in the order: RSSI, Frequency, Checksum, with prefixes R, F, K respectively, separated by semicolons.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_PACKET_OPTION

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new packet option value
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • getRegion

      @NonNull public String getRegion()
      Gets the current regulatory region setting of the RFID module.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_REGION

      Returns:
      The current region code, or empty string if unavailable

    • setRegion

      @NonNull public String setRegion(String newValue)
      Sets the regulatory region for the RFID module.

      The region setting determines the frequency band and power limits according to local regulations.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_REGION

      Parameters:
      newValue - The new region code
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed
      See Also:
      • getSupportedRegions()

    • getSupportedRegions

      @NonNull public Map<String,String> getSupportedRegions()
      Gets a mapping of supported regulatory regions for this device.

      The returned map contains region names as keys and region codes as values/p>

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_SUPPORTED_REGIONS

      Returns:
      A map of region names to region codes, or default US band regions if unavailable

    • getInformation

      @NonNull public Map<String,String> getInformation()
      Gets comprehensive device information including both RFID and system details.

      This method combines information from both the RFID module and system components, providing a complete overview of the device status.

      Action: Multiple internal actions to gather RFID and system information

      Returns:
      A map containing all available device information, or empty map if unavailable

    • getConfigurations

      @NonNull public Map<String,String> getConfigurations()
      Gets all current device configurations including both RFID and system settings.

      This method provides a comprehensive view of all configurable parameters in a single operation.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_SYSTEM_CONFIGURATION

      Returns:
      A map containing all current configuration values, or empty map if unavailable

    • setConfigurations

      @NonNull public String setConfigurations(Map<String,String> configurations)
      Sets multiple device configurations in a single operation.

      This method allows batch configuration updates for both RFID and system parameters, providing efficient configuration management.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_SYSTEM_CONFIGURATION

      Parameters:
      configurations - A map of configuration keys and values to apply
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if all configurations were applied successfully, Constants.Values.FAIL if any configuration failed

    • getContinuousMode

      @NonNull public String getContinuousMode()
      Gets the activation status of continuous mode.

      When continuous mode is disabled (default), inventory operations are performed by pressing and holding the trigger button. When continuous mode is enabled, double-tapping the trigger will start automatic continuous inventory operations that continue without further trigger input.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.READ_CONTINUOUS_MODE

      Returns:
      The continuous mode status: "c" if enabled (double-tap activation), "p" if disabled (hold trigger mode), or empty string if unavailable

    • setContinuousMode

      @NonNull public String setContinuousMode(String newValue)
      Sets whether the RF88 will activate continuous mode.

      When set to "p" (disabled): Inventory operations require pressing and holding the trigger button. When set to "c" (enabled): Double-tapping the trigger will start automatic continuous inventory operations.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.WRITE_CONTINUOUS_MODE

      Parameters:
      newValue - "c" to enable continuous mode (double-tap activation), "p" to disable (hold trigger mode)
      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

      Returns:

      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • factoryDefaults

      @NonNull public String factoryDefaults()
      Resets all device configurations to factory default values.

      This operation resets both RFID and system configurations to their original factory settings. This action cannot be undone.

      Warning: This will erase all custom configuration settings.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.EXECUTE_FACTORY_DEFAULT

      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • defaultRfidSettings

      @NonNull public String defaultRfidSettings()
      Resets only the RFID module configurations to factory default values.

      This operation resets RFID-related configurations while preserving system-level settings such as device name, buzzer volume, etc.

      Action: Bridge.Actions.EXECUTE_FACTORY_DEFAULT_RFID

      Returns:
      Constants.Values.SUCCESS if successful, Constants.Values.FAIL if failed

    • buildLockPayload

      private android.util.Pair<String,String> buildLockPayload(ex.dev.sdk.rf88.domain.enums.LockMemoryMask memory, ex.dev.sdk.rf88.domain.enums.LockActionMask action)
